oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Intensive larval culture of Macrobrachium rosenbergii : a cost study
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: AQUACOP
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pilot scale larval culture of Macrobrachium rosenbergii began in Tahiti at the end of 1976. Since then, four batches of postlarvae (2.3 millions) have been produced. Operating expenses cost was $13-35/thousands postlarvae. Based on the results obtained from the pilot program, we can project the cost of a commercial scale hatchery producing 10 million postlarvae/ year at $12/1,000. This includes construction and equipment costs. Due to the high cost of living in Tahiti, this figure would undoubtedly be lower in many other regions. [NOT CONTROLLED OCR]
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: 10 th Meeting of the World Mariculture Society. Honolulu, January 1979
